questions.question_text: Which of the following configuration change controls is acceptable to a cloud auditor?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Programmers cannot make uncontrolled changes to the source code production version.

This option is acceptable to a cloud auditor because it indicates that there are controls in place to prevent unauthorized or uncontrolled changes to the production environment. Ensuring that programmers cannot make uncontrolled changes helps maintain the integrity, security, and stability of the production system. This control is essential for protecting against potential errors or malicious activities that could disrupt operations or compromise data.

The other options present potential issues:
- A. Hosting development, test, and production environments on the same network can lead to security risks and lack of proper segregation.
- B. Granting programmers permanent access to production software can increase the risk of unauthorized changes.
- C. Allowing the Head of Development to approve changes to production without additional oversight may not provide sufficient checks and balances.
This question is weird, technically they are all acceptable except for B.

choices.A: Development, test and production are hosted in the same network environment.
choices.C: The Head of Development approves changes requested to production.
choices.D: Programmers cannot make uncontrolled changes to the source code production version.
choices.B: Programmers have permanent access to production software.

questions.question_text: Organizations maintain mappings between the different control frameworks they adopt to:

choices.B: avoid duplication of work when assessing compliance.
choices.A: help identify controls with common assessment status.
choices.D: start a compliance assessment using latest assessment.
choices.C: help identify controls with different assessment status.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. avoid duplication of work when assessing compliance.

Mapping between control frameworks allows organizations to identify where controls overlap or align across different standards. This helps streamline the compliance assessment process, making it more efficient by avoiding redundant evaluations of similar or equivalent controls across multiple frameworks. By understanding these relationships, organizations can reduce the effort and resources required to maintain compliance with multiple standards or regulations.
Avoid Duplication of work ... Answer is B
B. Avoid duplication of work. Section 2.7.5 of the CCAK Study Guide

questions.question_text: In cloud computing, with whom does the responsibility and accountability for compliance lie?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
CCAK Study guide page:269
When using cloud services, security responsibilities vary in large part depending on the service delivery model used, while responsibility and accountability for compliance remain entirely with the cloud customer.

comments.content: Compliance responsibilities always lies with customer

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. The cloud service customer is responsible and accountable for compliance.

In cloud computing, the responsibility and accountability for compliance primarily lie with the cloud service customer. While the cloud service provider (CSP) is responsible for ensuring that their infrastructure and services comply with relevant standards and regulations, the ultimate responsibility for ensuring that applications, data, and operations within the cloud environment comply with legal and regulatory requirements rests with the cloud customer. This is because the customer understands their specific compliance obligations and how their data and applications are configured and used within the cloud.

Selected Answer: C
It is surely C

questions.question_text: The BEST method to report continuous assessment of a cloud provider’s services to the CSA is through:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The best method to report continuous assessment of a cloud provider’s services to the Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) is typically through:

A. a set of dedicated application programming interfaces (APIs).

Using dedicated APIs allows for automated, real-time reporting and monitoring of the cloud provider's services, which can be more efficient and provide continuous insights compared to periodic assessments like SOC 2 Type 2 attestation or CCM assessments. APIs can facilitate ongoing data exchange and integration, providing timely and accurate information about the cloud services.

Selected Answer: A
Agree option A.

Selected Answer: A
p. 385, CCAK Study Guide - (Note: this question asks about reporting to the CSA)
"Once the Initialization phase is completed, the continuous audit phase starts, running for up to a full year. 
The continuous audit phase includes:
• The third-party auditor periodically periodically preforms checks to confirm that the assessment tools are trustworthy (e.g., integrity checks).
• The assessment tools continuously report the results of the assessment of each defined security objective to CSA through a dedicated API, according to the frequency defined in policies within the continuous certification target:"

choices.C: CCM assessment by a third-party auditor on a periodic basis.
choices.D: tools selected by the third-party auditor.
choices.A: a set of dedicated application programming interfaces (APIs).

questions.question_text: With regard to the Cloud Control Matrix (CCM), the ‘Architectural Relevance’ is a feature that enables the filtering of security controls by:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. relevant architecture frameworks such as the NIST Enterprise Architecture Model, the Federal Enterprise Architecture Framework (FEAF), The Open Group Architecture Framework (TOGAF), and the Zachman Framework for Enterprise Architecture.

The 'Architectural Relevance' feature in the Cloud Control Matrix (CCM) allows users to filter security controls based on various architecture frameworks, enabling them to align their security measures with established architectural standards and models. This helps in ensuring that the security controls are relevant and applicable to the specific architectural context they are operating within.

Selected Answer: D
P 212
"The CCM has six columns for architectural relevance, which includes applicability to the physical infrastructure, network, compute, storage, applications, data, or all of these areas. Applicability of architectural relevance to the corresponding control is marked with an X in the column. Columns can be used for filtering."

choices.A: relevant architecture frameworks such as the NIST Enterprise Architecture Model, the Federal Enterprise Architecture Framework (FEAF), The Open Group Architecture Framework (TOGAF), and the Zachman Framework for Enterprise Architecture.
choices.C: relevant architectural paradigms such as Client-Server, Mainframe, Peer-to-Peer, and SmartClient-Backend.
choices.B: relevant delivery models such as Software as a Service, Platform as a Service, Infrastructure as a Service.
choices.D: relevant architectural components such as Physical, Network, Compute, Storage, Application, and Data.
